t: For*pn Zion’s sake I will not keep silent, for*ld Jerusalem’s sake I will not remain quiet, till*ln her vindication shines out like the dawn, her*ld salvation like a blazing torch.
The*ln nations will see your vindication, and*ld all kings your glory; you*ln will be called by a new name that*ld the mouth of the Lord*s will bestow.
You*ln will be a crown of splendor in the Lord’s*s hand, a*ld royal diadem in the hand of your God.

No*ln longer will they call you Deserted, or*ld name your land Desolate. But*ln you will be called Hephzibah, and*ld your land Beulah; for*ln the Lord*s will take delight in you, and*ld your land will be married.
As*ln a young man marries a young woman, so*ld will your Builder marry you; as*ln a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so*ld will your God rejoice over you.
I*pn have posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem; they*ld will never be silent day or night. You*ln who call on the Lord,*s give*ld yourselves no rest,
and*ln give him no rest till he establishes Jerusalem and*ld makes her the praise of the earth.

The*pn Lord*s has sworn by his right hand and*ld by his mighty arm: “Never*ln again will I give your grain as*ld food for your enemies, and*ln never again will foreigners drink the new wine for*ld which you have toiled;
but*ln those who harvest it will eat it and*ld praise the Lord,*s and*ln those who gather the grapes will drink it in*ld the courts of my sanctuary.”
Pass*pn through, pass through the gates! Prepare*ld the way for the people. Build*ln up, build up the highway! Remove*ld the stones. Raise*ln a banner for the nations.
The*pn Lord*s has made proclamation to*ld the ends of the earth: “Say*ln to Daughter Zion, ‘See,*ld your Savior comes! See,*ln his reward is with him, and*ld his recompense accompanies him.’ ”
They*ln will be called the Holy People, the*ld Redeemed of the Lord;*s and*ln you will be called Sought After, the*ld City No Longer Deserted.
